fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators

Class CoordinationEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.SimulationEngine
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.CoordinationEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableInitialisationI, CoordinatorI, ParentNotificationI, SimulationManagementI, SimulatorI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoordinationRTEngine

    public class CoordinationEngine
extends SimulationEngine
implements CoordinatorI
    The class CoordinationEngine defines the basic behaviours of a DEVS coordinator declared by the interface CoordinationI.

    Description

    A DEVS coordination engine is first linked to a DEVS simulation model through the method setSimulatedModel. It then can do simulations by calling doStandAloneSimulation or startCollaborativeSimulation. Simulations end either by reaching their end simulation time or by calling stopSimulation.

    The implementation provided here follows the spirit of the description appearing in:

    H. Vangheluwe, Discrete Event System Specification (DEVS) formalism, courseware, 2001.

    Note: the implementation in non-reentrant, hence simulation runs using this one instantiation of a composed model must be executed in sequence.

    A baseline DEVS simulator observe a protocol built around the following operations:

    • internal event step: processing an internal event at a given simulated time;
    • external event step: processing a given external event at a given simulated time.

    See AtomicModelI for a description of internal and external steps. A stand alone simulation is run by iterating internal steps until the end of the simulation. A modular concurrent or distributed simulation requires the exchange of external events, the coordination of clock advances to always execute the next event that occurs and the execution of external event steps when required.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       !coordinatedEnginesSet() || Stream.of(coordinatedEngines).allMatch(s -> ((CoupledModelI)simulatedModel).isSubmodel(s.getSimulatedModel().getURI()) & coordinatedURI2index.containsKey(s.getSimulatedModel().getURI()))
 invariant       !coordinatedEnginesSet() || coordinatedURI2index.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> ((CoupledModelI)simulatedModel).isSubmodel(e.getKey()) && Stream.of(coordinatedEngines).anyMatch(s -> s.getSimulatedModel().getURI().equals(e.getKey()) && e.getValue() >= 0 && e.getValue() < coordinatedEngines.length))

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2018-04-06

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Set<java.lang.String> activeModelURIs
      Set of URIs of submodels that have external events waiting executed.
      protected SimulatorI[] coordinatedEngines
      Simulation engines coordinated by this coordination engine.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> coordinatedURI2index
      Map from URI of the models enacted by coordinated engines to the index of the engine in the array coordinatedEngines.
      protected Duration[] elapsedTimes
      Elapsed times of subengines since their last internal event (i.e., currentStateTime; conceptually, the time of the last internal event plus the elapsed time corresponds to the current global simulation time.
      protected java.util.Random randomGenerator
      Random number generator used to break the ties when several submodels can perform an internal transition at the same time of next internal transition simulation time.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected java.lang.String submodelOfNextEventURI
      The URI of the submodel that will need to execute the next event.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static boolean blackBoxInvariants(CoordinationEngine instance)
      return true if the black-box invariants are observed, false otherwise.
      protected void computeNextEventToBeSimulated()
      compute the next event to be simulated and update the internal state accordingly.
      boolean coordinatedEnginesSet()
      return true if the coordinated engines have been set for this coordination engine.
      void endSimulation(Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation, doing the necessary catering tasks.
      void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.
      void finaliseSimulation()
      finalise the simulation, disposing all resources and reinitialising the models and simulators so that a new simulation run can be undertaken.
      protected static boolean glassBoxInvariants(CoordinationEngine instance)
      return true if the glass-box invariants are observed, false otherwise.
      void hasPerformedExternalEvents(java.lang.String modelURI)
      notify the pa rent model that the child model modelURI has performed its current external events; used when a coupled model has its children models perform the external events sent by other models among its children and need not be called upon its external event step method anymore.
      void hasReceivedExternalEvents(java.lang.String modelURI)
      notify the parent model that the model modelURI has received some external events during the execution of another model internal step and therefore that it will need to perform an external step during the current simulation step.
      void initialiseSimulation(Time startTime, Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      protected void initialiseSimulationBypass(Time startTime, Duration simulationDuration)
      provides a way for the subclass to call SimulationEngine bypassing this level.
      void internalEventStep()
      process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.
      boolean isSimulationInitialised()
      return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.
      void produceOutput(Time current)
      force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.
      void setCoordinatedEngines(SimulatorI[] coordinatedEngines)
      set the simulation engines that are coordinated by this coordination engine.
      void setSimulatedModel(ModelI simulatedModel)
      set the simulated model, ensuring that it is a coupled model.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the current state.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the content of the current state, without pre- and post-formatting.
      java.lang.String simulatorAsString()
      return the simulator information as a string.

      • initialiseSimulation

        public void initialiseSimulation(Time startTime,
                                 Duration simulationDuration)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.

        Contract

         pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     simulationStartTime != null
 pre     simulationStartTime.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationStartTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())) 
 pre     simulationDuration != null
 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    !this.getSimulatedModel().isRoot() || isSimulationInitialised()
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Specified by:
        initialiseSimulation in interface SimulatorI
        Overrides:
        initialiseSimulation in class SimulationEngine
        Parameters:

      • produceOutput

        public void produceOutput(Time current)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" of DEVS i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing through their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        produceOutput in interface SimulatorI
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • externalEventStep

        public void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorI
        process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.

        The processing first cancel the previously forecast internal event if any and then make the transition to a new model state given the processed external event and then forecast a new internal event.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Specified by:
        externalEventStep in interface SimulatorI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time elapsed since the last event executed by this engine.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.externalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)
